title: The Forgetting
story_summary: In 2025's Stenograd, the city's fate turned on the invisible currents of the Behavioral Compliance Index, a system so powerful it quietly shaped every life. When its architect, Marek Halden, died mysteriously, the city's automated order began to crack. The Directorate seized control, cutting power and transit to rebellious districts in a harsh 'Harmony Reset,' driving already tense citizens into outrage and chaos. As once-compliant neighborhoods faltered, internal rifts within the ruling Council erupted, and public unrest surged under the lens of reporter Rada Miskovic. But a deeper crisis loomed: Halden's last act triggered the wholesale deletion of the BCI's surveillance records, upending the foundations of trust and control. As scores and histories vanished, some celebrated newfound freedom, others grieved lost justice, and the city teetered between rebuilding its algorithmic regime or letting memory and governance dissolve forever.

official.headline: System Status Reset
official.anchor_line: Today, city officials confirm adjustments to record-keeping across all BCI services.
official.contextual_reframing: Routine upgrades and strategic data management underscore the ongoing commitment to public order and adaptability.

official.headline: Communal Response Unfolds
official.anchor_line: Residents gather peacefully as Stenograd transitions to a new phase of administration.
official.contextual_reframing: Community engagement remains strong as systems evolve, showcasing resilience and unity during technical transitions.

official.headline: A New Civic Choice
official.anchor_line: A citywide referendum is announced, empowering citizens to help shape the next era of urban management.
official.contextual_reframing: Participatory governance enhances stability. Stenograd moves forward, balancing collective memory and systemic innovation.

underground.headline: History Wiped Away
underground.anchor_line: First the Harmony Reset, now our records vanish overnight.
underground.contextual_reframing: No more BCI files. No more old scores. For some, freedom. For others, a chance for the Council to erase every mistake they made.

underground.headline: Who Decides Now?
underground.anchor_line: People fill the squares, not knowing if they're safe or in danger without score protections.
underground.contextual_reframing: Confusion everywhere. Justice for abuses at risk as evidence disappears. Those who suffered might get nothing but silence.

underground.headline: Past or Future?
underground.anchor_line: Rada leaks: Halden set the purge in motion himself, forcing us to pick - more control or no memory at all.
underground.contextual_reframing: With the system gone, we stand at a crossroads. Rebuild the machines - or let Stenograd become whatever we dare to remember.
